block.p: Andrea Jill London, the daughter of Karen Davis of Cambridge, Mass., and Stephen D. London of West Roxbury, Mass., will be married today to John Jay Gilstrap, a son of Jeannette and John Gilstrap of Manhattan. Anne Holland, a justice of the peace, is to officiate at the Mansion on Turner Hill, a historic house in Ipswich, Mass.

The couple work in London. The bride, 33, is a senior vice president for sales at Intralinks, a New York-based Internet security company. The bridegroom, 38, is a vice president for media and telecommunications companies with Chase H&Q, an investment division of the Chase Manhattan Bank.

Andrea Jill London, the daughter of Karen Davis of Cambridge, Mass., and Stephen D. London of West Roxbury, Mass., will be married today to John Jay Gilstrap, a son of Jeannette and John Gilstrap of Manhattan. Anne Holland, a justice of the peace, is to officiate at the Mansion on Turner Hill, a historic house in Ipswich, Mass.

The couple work in London. The bride, 33, is a senior vice president for sales at Intralinks, a New York-based Internet security company. The bridegroom, 38, is a vice president for media and telecommunications companies with Chase H&Q, an investment division of the Chase Manhattan Bank.

The bride graduated from Bowdoin College. Her mother is a freelance photographer. Her father is the chairman of the sociology department at Simmons College in Boston. Her stepfather, Mark M. Orton, is the chief product officer of ValuEdge, a software company in Medford, Mass. Her stepmother, Deirdre London, is a nurse at Brookline High School in Brookline, Mass.

The bridegroom graduated from Dartmouth College and received an M.B.A. from Columbia University. His mother teaches business at Roosevelt High School in the Bronx. His father retired as a Fire Department captain with Engine Company 82 in the South Bronx.
The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.

WEDDINGS Correction: September 3, 2000, Sunday A report last Sunday about the marriage of Andrea Jill London and John Jay Gilstrap misstated the number of the fire unit in the South Bronx from which the bridegroom's father, John Gilstrap, retired as a captain. It was Engine Company 92, not 82.

A report last Sunday about the marriage of Andrea Jill London and John Jay Gilstrap misstated the number of the fire unit in the South Bronx from which the bridegroom's father, John Gilstrap, retired as a captain. It was Engine Company 92, not 82.
